pros: First meeting with a work environment, specifically for young students
cons: A quite considerable amount of time spent doing this type of experience

pros: Opportunity for everyone to be part of an amazing team where people have the possibility for stand for themselves and really make an impact thanks to their ideas. The best thing about aiesec is that when you join the team ( the mine was in Venice ) you can choose among the areas that suits you the most. The mine was Outgoing Exchange Program, my task, as a Team Leader was to manage a ground of 5 people on the process that ends with the matching of the candidates, that applied for a 6 week experience project in one of the many countries AIESEC is.
cons: The only thing is that, if you are a student, you have to find a correct balance between study and AIESEC work, in order to don't miss undergoing exams.

job_title: Vice-President of Talent Management in Milan
pros: Great culture and values, amazing development experience. Opens opportunities for the whole new world of different cultures, dynamic environment, created by students for students
cons: No life-work balance, as a non-for-profit organization you receive no salary or few. Sometimes organizational culture is too cultistic. And every time activities in this organization bring you to the challenging level, but sometimes too challenging

review_title: Great place to kickoff your working experience
job_title: Vice President Talent Management in Bologna
pros: Gain a lot of soft skills, learn how to plan and execute a project, learn to be responsible for your own activities. Lot of self-reflection and self-improving activities. Learn to work in an international team.
cons: Can be demanding in terms of workload, no salary.

pros: Great learning experience, freedom to take decisions, high responsibility level for young people to learn
cons: Financially it doesn't make you gain money, people in AIESEC do it for learning and to contribute to the country and not for money. So if you look for money, just don't.

review_title: A true leadership development platform, delivers more than you can expect
pros:
- Incredible learning curve
- High responsibilities
- Highly meritocratic
cons:
- Almost non existent salary
- Sometimes not too profit oriented
- Long working hours

pros:
- good environment
- young students network 
- capabilities to put into practice what you learn at university
- improve your English speaking with international partners
cons: - No salary but of course because is a volunteer job in the early stages

pros:
Great team experience
 Value based organization
Opportunity to develop different skills
Great connections with companies for job seeking afterwards

review_title: Incoming Global Volunteer - National Product Head
pros: Dynamic environment, ability to take decisions and shape projects, learning by doing environment.
International environment, you get to learn how to manage your time while studying
